ATTACHMENT A

DEFINITIONS
1. “CardConnect” means Defendant CardConnect, LLC., including all d/b/a names, parents,
subsidiaries, divisions, affiliates, predecessors, and successors, and all present and former officers,
directors, managing agents, agents and employees, and all other persons acting or purporting to act on
behalf of CardConnect, LLC.
2. “Shift4” means Plaintiff Shift4 Payments, LLC, including all d/b/a names, parents, subsidiaries,
divisions, affiliates, predecessors, and successors, and all present and former officers, directors,
managing agents, agents and employees, and all other persons acting or purporting to act on behalf of
Shift4 Payments, LLC.
3. “Person(s)” means any natural person, association, proprietorship, partnership, joint venture,
corporation, limited liability company, trust, business trust, and any other form of business or legal
entity.
4. “Document(s)” or “Documentation” means any “writing” and/or “recording” and/or “photograph”
as defined in FRE 1001, and specifically includes, without limitation, correspondence, notes, memoranda,
diaries, calendars, desk calendars, notes or minutes of meetings, telephone calls or conferences, accounting
data, ledgers, reports, statements, summaries, projections, analyses, photographs, microfilm, microfiche,
computer printouts, emails, text messages, instant messages, data stored within any form of computer
storage, and any other written, printed, typed, graphic, electronic, digital, or recorded matter of any kind
however produced or reproduced.
5. "Communication" means any contact, discussion, exchange of information, or transmittal of
documents between two or more persons, whether by telephone, in person, by mail, delivery service,
electronic mail, facsimile transmission, video, text, or other form of oral or written communication.
6. “Any” means “each and every” as well as “any one of.”
7. “Relating to” means relating to, alluding to, referring to, constituting, concerning, comprising,
describing, containing, discussing, evidencing, reflecting, stating, mentioning, studying, evaluating,
analyzing, identifying, setting forth, directly or indirectly pertaining to in any way.
8. “Agreement” means the Amended & Restated Referral Partner Agreement by and between
Shift4 and CardConnect, dated January 1, 2018.
9. “DOJ/HSR Matter” means the second request for production of documents CardConnect
received in March 2019 from the Department of Justice in relation to the Hart-Scott-Rodino review of
Fiserv, Inc.’s acquisition of First Data Corporation of which CardConnect is an affiliate.
10. The singular form of a noun or pronoun shall be considered to include within its meaning the plural
when appropriate, and vice-versa.
11. The use of a verb in any tense shall be construed as the use of the verb in all tenses where
appropriate.
12. The words “and” and “or” shall be construed conjunctively or disjunctively as necessary to make
the request inclusive rather than exclusive.

INSTRUCTIONS
1. If any document requested herein was, but no longer is, in your possession, custody, or control,
state what disposition was made of the document, by whom, the date of the disposition, and the reason
for the disposition.
2. If you do not have documents responsive to a particular request, so state.
3. Unless otherwise specified, the time period covered by this Subpoena is from January 1, 2017
through the present to and including the date of your responses to this Subpoena.
4. This request for production of documents should be deemed continuing and Defendant is
requested to supplement their responses and production upon the discovery of additional information
and/or documentation that is responsive to this request.
5. In the event you believe any document responsive to any document requests is subject to
privilege or is otherwise protected from production, each such document shall be identified in a privilege
log. The privilege log shall set forth:
    a. The number of the production request to which the document is responsive;
	b. The date of the document;
	c. The author, addressee, and all recipients of the document;
 d. A description of the document sufficient to identify its subject matter (without revealing privileged or protected information);
	e. The nature of the privilege as to which protection is claimed; and
	f. Any additional information necessary to substantiate the claim of privilege.
6. If any document contains both privileged and non-privileged matter, the non-privileged portion of
the document must be produced after truth of the portion claimed to be privileged. The truth
should be made in a manner that preserves the context.
7. CardConnect is required to produce all responsive documents within its possession, custody or
control, or reasonably available to it, regardless of the physical location of such documents.
8. All documents produced pursuant to this subpoena shall be identified by the number of the
paragraph to which they respond, or otherwise separated or organized in such a manner as to facilitate
their identification as referring to a specific request of these document requests.
9. Documents that are attached to each other shall not be separated, and shall be produced still
attached to each other.
10. If any of the documents produced responsive to this request are in a language other than English,
please produce the English translation as well.
11. Documents shall be produced in native format, with relevant metadata preserved, and be text
searchable to maximize their usefulness and compatibility with the search functions of commonly used
e-discovery software platforms. If CardConnect is unable to produce any document in native format, it
shall state in writing the reasons why such production cannot occur.
12. For each document produced, please produce all metadata fields, including but not limited to:
Document Type; Author; Recipient(s); CC; BCC; Custodian; Date Created; Date Modified; Date Sent;
Date Received; Document Title, File Name; File Path; File Size; and MD5 Hash Value.

REQUESTS FOR PRODUCTION

REQUEST FOR PRODUCTION NO. 1: All communications between CardConnect
(including but not limited to Taylor LaGroue, Randy Miskanic, Abe Marc, Angelo Grecco, Chuck
Fillman, and/or Patrick Shanahan) and Shift4 (including but not limited to Jered Isaacman, Michael
Isaacman, J.D. Oder II, T.J. Oder, Daniel DeMedio, and/or Nate Hirshberg).

REQUEST FOR PRODUCTION NO. 2: All documents concerning the negotiation and/or
performance of the Agreement.

REQUEST FOR PRODUCTION NO. 3: All documents concerning any alleged or actual
breaches or violations of the Agreement by Shift4 and/or CardConnect.

REQUEST FOR PRODUCTION NO. 4: All documents concerning CardConnect’s decision
to terminate the Agreement.

REQUEST FOR PRODUCTION NO. 5: All documents concerning the DOJ/HSR Matter.

REQUEST FOR PRODUCTION NO. 6: All documents, including any legal opinions,
concerning whether CardConnect was permitted to disclose information about the Agreement and/or the
